page.title: 15ACCIDENT RESCUE: ACTON/L'HAM
page.content: In addition to the NHS an Accident Rescue Service has been evolved in the County of Suffolk to render skilled medical help at the scene of any emer- gency (road, rail, industrial, farming or domestic). Doctors participate in the scheme linked by radio to Police Fire and Ambulance Service, enabling them to reach the scene quickly. In a sparsely populated area this is a valuable life saving service, and is the second largest immediate care scheme in the country. There are four military bases involved giving the added bonus of speedy air transport. Doctors participate in the service on a voluntary basis and monies for equipment etc. are raised by volun- tary subscription and fund raising activies.
